intro: Asperula lycia, commonly known as the Persian speedwell, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its small, blue or violet flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters and features opposite, ovate leaves with a hairy texture. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Asperula lycia is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional herbal medicine.
